RDFShard.ModelingStrategy

Method Detail

isModelTBoxInABox

public boolean isModelTBoxInABox()
Using this mapping, all ontology relations are treated as simple triples; this means OWL axioms such as HeartVentricle SubClassOf (part_of Heart) are treated as triples: HeartVentricle part_f Heart Background: Normally, each subClassOf OWL axiom is converted to a single RDF triple, but other relations follow a different pattern. OWL has no notion of “edges” in an ontology graph as such. Instead, edges such as “HeartVentricle part_of Heart” (taken from the adult mouse anatomy ontology) are treated as subclass axioms between (a) a named class and (b) an owl description . Here the description is an owl:Restriction representing the class of all things that are part of the heart. When we convert a part_of edge to RDF via OWL we end up with 4 triples. In turtle syntax: HeartVentricle rdfs:subClassOf [a owl:Restriction ; onProperty: ro:part_of ; someValuesFrom: Heart ] Note the part in []s denotes an RDF bNode. The Restriction is (typically) unnamed. The low level RDF details are hidden from us if we use a Jena ontModel; however, the details are not hidden at the SPARQL level. This means that if this pattern is not used, SPARQL queries must be expanded to use the full OWL-in-RDF encoding

Returns:

setModelTBoxInABox

public void setModelTBoxInABox(boolean useTBoxInABoxPattern)

isAlwaysAssertReifiedStatement

public boolean isAlwaysAssertReifiedStatement()
if this is true then any reified statement ?st subject ?su ?st predicate ?pr ?st object ?ob is always accompanied by a triple ?su ?pr ?ob if false, then the accompanying triple is optional

isModelAnnotationsAsTriples

public boolean isModelAnnotationsAsTriples()
if true, a simple triple pattern is always used for annotations, even class-class annotations. This can lead to OWL-Full

isModelAnnotationsUsingReification

public boolean isModelAnnotationsUsingReification()
if true, provenance metadata is attached to annotation links via reification. If false, named graphs are used
